column1: the  superior courts  takes  up so  much  time and adds  up  to  the
delay and the  backlog of cases  pending in  Courts.  Very often
the  dealing  of such  technicalities  become  only  an  academic

exercise  with  which 
the 
litigants  would  not  be 
interested.

The  delay 
in  dispensation  of justice  can  be  minimized  if

parties  are  discouraged  from 
taking  up  technical  objections
which  takes  up valuable judicial  time.  What is  important for
litigants  would be  their aspiration  to  get justice from  courts

on  merits  rather  than  on 
technicalities.  As  has  often  been
